intro: Thlaspi ruderale, commonly known as field pennycress, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of pinnately lobed leaves and small, yellow flowers that develop in racemes. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. It produces small, round seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution. Thlaspi ruderale is also known for its ability to tolerate various environmental conditions, making it a resilient weed in agricultural settings.
